instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A Not recognizing, doesn't see SSD, questionmark folder.
threads.message:
Hello I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with problem with detected ssd, voltage and resistance in connector is normal, i replace <CHIP>U4510</CHIP> but still the same, drive was seen when i connect with usb. SSD have HFS. About history of this computer i know that customer put in this bad adapter with this ssd (photos). After this operation, Macbook don't recognizing any SSD in J4501.

<SIGNAL>SSD_P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> - 3,34V
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3,34V
PP3V3 S0 SSD FLT - 3,34

This is my first topic, if I do something wrong, please correct me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A Not recognizing, doesn't see SSD, questionmark folder.
threads.message: After when I write this topic, i  find solution. Problem is in L4500, this bad coil Have 500 Ohms. Customer do short PP3V3 S0 SSD FLT and Coil was burned in half.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A Not recognizing, doesn't see SSD, questionmark folder.
threads.message:
Always check real ohm value of a coil in case like this.
You can get normal voltage without SSD, but voltage drops drastically once SSD is inserted.

BTW, welcome to the forum!
